    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Peer getInstance()

        the singleton instance of the class

      • initPeer

        public void initPeer(java.lang.String protocolVersion,
                     int peerID,
                     java.lang.String accessPoint,
                     java.net.InetAddress mccAddr,
                     int mccPort,
                     java.net.InetAddress mdbAddr,
                     int mdbPort,
                     java.net.InetAddress mdrAddr,
                     int mdrPort)
        Initialises singleton Peer object. A Peer object handles protocol initiation and also requests for protocol handling from other initiators on known UDP multicast channels. Peers have the function of managing a file backup service and store information about their own database and what they believe the system currently has stored.
        Parameters:
        protocolVersion - the backup system version
        peerID - the numeric identifier of the Peer
        accessPoint - service access point (RMI Object name)
        mccAddr - address of the multicast control channel
        mccPort - port for the multicast control channel
        mdbAddr - address of the multicast data backup channel
        mdbPort - port for the multicast data backup channel
        mdrAddr - address of the multicast data restore channel
        mdrPort - port for the multicast data restore channel

      • initRMI

        public void initRMI()
        Register remote object in RMI registry so it can be called by TestApp

        Returns:

      • remoteBackup

        public void remoteBackup(java.lang.String filepath,
                         int repDeg)
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                         java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: RMITesting
        Triggers the backup protocol with the invoking Peer as Initiator Peer.
        Specified by:
        remoteBackup in interface RMITesting
        Parameters:
        filepath - path to file to backup
        repDeg - desired number of copies of the file in the system
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        java.lang.InterruptedException
